name: Autocomplete
description: The Autocomplete component, also know as a ComboBox, completes / suggests values during typing.

props.name: mode
props.doc: If set to `async`, it prevents showing the "no options" message during typing / filtering. Defaults to `sync`.

props.name: input_value
props.doc: Lets you define a custom input value. Setting it to an empty string `""` will reset the input value.

props.name: placeholder
props.doc: Use this to define the pre-filled placeholder text in the input. Defaults to `title="Skriv og velg"`.

props.name: title
props.doc: Give a title to let the user know what they have to do. Defaults to `Skriv og få alternativer`.

props.name: disable_filter
props.doc: If set to `true`, word highlighting will still be active, but no options will be filtered out. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: disable_highlighting
props.doc: If set to `true`, word highlighting will be disabled, but the options will still get filtered. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: disable_reorder
props.doc: If set to `true`, reordering of search results will be disabled. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: search_numbers
props.doc: If set to `true` and `search_in_word_index` is not set, the user will be able to more easily search and filter e.g. bank account numbers. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: search_in_word_index
props.doc: This gives you the possibility to change the threshold number, which defines from what word on we search "inside words". Defaults to `3`.

props.name: keep_value
props.doc: Use `true` to not remove the typed value on input blur, if it is invalid. By default, the typed value will disappear / replaced by a selected value from the data list during the input field blur. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: keep_selection
props.doc: Use `true` to not remove selected item on input blur, when the input value is empty. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: keep_value_and_selection
props.doc: Like `keep_value` – but would not reset to the selected value during input field blur. Also, the selected value would still be kept. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: prevent_selection
props.doc: If set to `true`, no permanent selection will be made. Also, the typed value will not disappear on input blur (like `keep_value`). Defaults to `false`.

props.name: show_clear_button
props.doc: If set to `true`, a clear button is shown inside the input field. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: icon
props.doc: To be included in the autocomplete input.

props.name: icon_size
props.doc: Change the size of the icon pragmatically.

props.name: icon_position
props.doc: Position of the icon inside the autocomplete. Set to `left` or `right`. Defaults to `left`.

props.name: input_icon
props.doc: Same as `icon`.

props.name: triangle_position
props.doc: Position of icon arrow / triangle the drawer. Set to `left` or `right`. Defaults to `left`.

props.name: size
props.doc: Define the height of the Autocomplete. Can be set to `small`, `default`, `medium` and `large`. Defaults to `default`.

props.name: drawer_class
props.doc: Define a custom class for the internal drawer-list. This makes it possible more easily customize the drawer-list style with styled-components and the `css` style method. Defaults to `null`.

props.name: show_submit_button
props.doc: Use `true` to show a Autocomplete button to toggle the [DrawerList](/uilib/components/fragments/drawer-list). Defaults to `false`.

props.name: align_autocomplete
props.doc: Use `right` to change the options alignment direction. Defaults to `left`.

props.name: no_options
props.doc: Text show in the "no options" item. If set to `false`, the list will not be rendered when there are no options available. Defaults to `Ingen alternativer`.

props.name: aria_live_options
props.doc: Text read out by screen readers. This way users with screen readers know how many options they got during typing. Defaults to `%s alternativer`.

props.name: show_all
props.doc: Text that lets a user unravel all the available options. Defaults to `Vis alt`.

props.name: indicator_label
props.doc: Text show on indicator "options" item. Defaults to `Henter data ...`.

props.name: show_options_sr
props.doc: Only for screen readers. Title of the button to show the suggestions / options. It is always present and when activating, it opens the DrawerList and sets the focus on it. Defaults to `Bla gjennom alternativer`.

props.name: selected_sr
props.doc: Only for screen readers (VoiceOver). The label used to announce the selected item. Defaults to `Valgt:`.

props.name: selectall
props.doc: If set to `true`, then the whole input value gets selected on the entry focus. A second click will place the cursor on the wanted position.

props.name: submit_button_title
props.doc: Title on submit button. Defaults to `Vis alternativer`.

props.name: submit_button_icon
props.doc: The icon used in the submit button. Defaults to `chevron_down`.

props.name: submit_element
props.doc: Replace the dropdown / submit button with a custom React element. Defaults to the input SubmitButton `import { SubmitButton } from '@dnb/eufemia/components/input/Input'`.

props.name: opened
props.doc: If set to `true`, the Autocomplete will be rendered initially with a visible and accessible data list / options.

props.name: open_on_focus
props.doc: Use `true` to auto open the list once the user is entering the input field with the keyboard.

props.name: stretch
props.doc: If set to `true`, then the autocomplete will be 100% in available `width`.

props.name: skip_portal
props.doc: Set to `true` to disable the React Portal behavior. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: status
props.doc: Text with a status message. The style defaults to an error message. You can use `true` to only get the status color, without a message.

props.name: status_state
props.doc: Defines the state of the status. Currently, there are two statuses `[error, info]`. Defaults to `error`.

props.name: status_props
props.doc: Use an object to define additional FormStatus properties.

props.name: globalStatus
props.doc: The [configuration](/uilib/components/global-status/properties/#configuration-object) used for the target [GlobalStatus](/uilib/components/global-status).

props.name: label
props.doc: Prepends the Form Label component. If no ID is provided, a random ID is created.

props.name: label_direction
props.doc: Use `label_direction="vertical"` to change the label layout direction. Defaults to `horizontal`.

props.name: label_sr_only
props.doc: Use `true` to make the label only readable by screen readers.

props.name: suffix
props.doc: Text describing the content of the Autocomplete more than the label. You can also send in a React component, so it gets wrapped inside the Autocomplete component.

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.

props.name: input_ref
props.doc: Use a React.Ref to get access to the `input` DOM element.

props.name: input_element
props.doc: Lets you provide a custom React element as the input HTML element.

events.name: on_type
events.doc: Will be called for every key change the users makes. Returns an object with the input `value` inside `{ value, event, attributes }` including [these methods](/uilib/components/autocomplete/events#dynamically-change-data)

events.name: on_focus
events.doc: Will be called on user generated focus action. Returns an object with the input `value` inside `{ value, event, attributes }` including [these methods](/uilib/components/autocomplete/events#dynamically-change-data).

events.name: on_blur
events.doc: Will be called on user generated blur action. Returns an object with the input `value` inside `{ value, event, attributes }` including [these methods](/uilib/components/autocomplete/events#dynamically-change-data).

events.name: on_change
events.doc: Will be called on state changes made by the user. Returns an object with the new selected `data` item `{ data, event, attributes, value }` including [these methods](/uilib/components/autocomplete/events#dynamically-change-data).

events.name: on_select
events.doc: Will be called once the users focuses or selects an item by a click or keyboard navigation. Returns an object with the new selected `data` item `{ data, event, attributes, value, active_item }` including [these methods](/uilib/components/autocomplete/events#dynamically-change-data). The "active_item" property is the currently selected item by keyboard navigation

events.name: on_show
events.doc: Will be called once the user presses the autocomplete. Returns the data item `{ data, attributes }`.

events.name: on_hide
events.doc: Will be called once the user presses the autocomplete again, or clicks somewhere else. Returns the data item `{ data, attributes }`.
